instructions.instruction: Read complete template schema file before generating any entry
instructions.original_snippets: Before generating any entry, you MUST read the complete template schema file: ... Do NOT generate entries without loading the schema first.
instructions.relevant_when: When creating any type of journal entry

instructions.instruction: Use four-phase workflow: Interactive Gathering, Schema Loading, Generation, Validation & Formatting
instructions.original_snippets: ## Four-Phase Workflow ... Phase 1: Interactive Gathering ... Phase 2: Schema Loading (MANDATORY) ... Phase 3: Generation ... Phase 4: Validation & Formatting
instructions.relevant_when: When creating journal entries to ensure systematic approach

instructions.instruction: Create filename with lowercase-only slug using hyphens
instructions.original_snippets: Generate filename: `YYYY-MM-DD-slug.md` (slug must be lowercase with hyphens only) ... **MUST be lowercase-only with hyphens** (NO uppercase letters, NO underscores)
instructions.relevant_when: When naming journal entry files

instructions.instruction: Maintain triple date sync across filename, frontmatter, and H1 title
instructions.original_snippets: All three must match exactly: 1. Filename: `2025-02-24-topic.md` 2. Frontmatter: `date: 2025-02-24` 3. H1 title: `# Topic - February 24, 2025`
instructions.relevant_when: When creating journal entries with dates

instructions.instruction: Use specific H1 date format: Month D, YYYY (not Month DD)
instructions.original_snippets: The H1 date format is `Month D, YYYY` (not `Month DD`). Example: `February 3, 2025` not `February 03, 2025`
instructions.relevant_when: When writing H1 titles with dates

instructions.instruction: Place files in YYYY/MM/ directory structure matching date
instructions.original_snippets: File must be in `YYYY/MM/` directory matching its date: - `2025-02-24-*.md` → Must be in `2025/02/`
instructions.relevant_when: When organizing journal entry files

instructions.instruction: Use exactly ONE H1 heading per document
instructions.original_snippets: Exactly ONE H1 in the entire document with precise format: ... **Not allowed:** - Multiple H1 headings
instructions.relevant_when: When structuring journal entry documents

instructions.instruction: Match tags between frontmatter array and Tags section
instructions.original_snippets: Tags must: 1. Match between frontmatter array and final `## Tags` section ... Must match: ## Tags `troubleshooting` | `api-gateway` | `aws-lambda`
instructions.relevant_when: When adding tags to journal entries

instructions.instruction: Use lowercase with hyphens for all tags
instructions.original_snippets: Be lowercase with hyphens (not underscores, not camelCase)
instructions.relevant_when: When creating tags for journal entries

instructions.instruction: Include entry type tag when required (troubleshooting, learning, article/video/podcast/talk)
instructions.original_snippets: Include entry type tag when required (troubleshooting, learning, article/video/podcast/talk)
instructions.relevant_when: When creating specific types of journal entries

instructions.instruction: All code blocks MUST have language identifiers
instructions.original_snippets: ALL code blocks MUST have language identifiers. No bare triple backticks allowed. ... **Invalid:** ``` git status ```
instructions.relevant_when: When including code blocks in journal entries

instructions.instruction: Run validation script before proceeding
instructions.original_snippets: bash skills/journal-entry-creator/scripts/validate-journal-entry.sh YYYY/MM/YYYY-MM-DD-slug.md
instructions.relevant_when: After creating journal entries

instructions.instruction: Run prettier formatting after validation passes
instructions.original_snippets: # 2. Format (only if validation passes) npx prettier --write YYYY/MM/YYYY-MM-DD-slug.md
instructions.relevant_when: When formatting completed journal entries

instructions.instruction: Run markdownlint with auto-fix after formatting
instructions.original_snippets: # 3. Lint and auto-fix npx markdownlint-cli2 YYYY/MM/YYYY-MM-DD-slug.md --fix
instructions.relevant_when: When linting completed journal entries

instructions.instruction: Never skip reading template schema before generation
instructions.original_snippets: - NEVER skip reading the template schema before generating entry
instructions.relevant_when: When creating any journal entry

instructions.instruction: Never use multiple H1 headings
instructions.original_snippets: - NEVER use multiple H1 headings (only one allowed)
instructions.relevant_when: When structuring journal documents

instructions.instruction: Never use bare code blocks without language specifiers
instructions.original_snippets: - NEVER use bare ``` code blocks without language specifier
instructions.relevant_when: When including code in journal entries

instructions.instruction: Never use uppercase in tags or filename slugs
instructions.original_snippets: - NEVER use uppercase in tags or slugs (`API` → `api`, `CloudWatch` → `cloudwatch`)
instructions.relevant_when: When naming files or creating tags

instructions.instruction: Never use underscores in slugs (use hyphens)
instructions.original_snippets: - NEVER use underscores in slugs (use hyphens: `api_fix` → `api-fix`)
instructions.relevant_when: When creating filename slugs

instructions.instruction: Never mismatch dates across filename, frontmatter, and H1
instructions.original_snippets: - NEVER mismatch dates across filename, frontmatter, and H1
instructions.relevant_when: When creating dated journal entries

instructions.instruction: Never use emojis in journal entries
instructions.original_snippets: - NEVER use emojis in journal entries (status, sections, or content)
instructions.relevant_when: When writing journal entry content

instructions.instruction: Never use bullet points in metadata blocks (use **Key:** Value format)
instructions.original_snippets: - NEVER use bullet points in metadata blocks (use `**Key:** Value` format only)
instructions.relevant_when: When creating metadata sections in journal entries

instructions.instruction: Ask user before overwriting existing files
instructions.original_snippets: Ask user: `Entry already exists at [path]. Overwrite? (y/N)`
instructions.relevant_when: When a journal entry file already exists at the target location

instructions.instruction: Use entry type decision framework to determine correct template
instructions.original_snippets: **Before selecting entry type, ask yourself:** - **Is this documenting a problem and its resolution?** → Troubleshooting - **Is this capturing new knowledge or skills acquired?** → Learning
instructions.relevant_when: When determining which type of journal entry to create

instructions.instruction: Create directory structure if needed: mkdir -p YYYY/MM
instructions.original_snippets: Create directory if needed: `mkdir -p YYYY/MM`
instructions.relevant_when: When the target directory doesn't exist for journal entry

instructions.instruction: Use bold formatting for metadata block keys
instructions.original_snippets: - NEVER create metadata block without bold formatting (`**Key:**`)
instructions.relevant_when: When creating metadata blocks in journal entries
